documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
, with whom 
Justices Scalia, Kennedy, and Thomas join, dissenting:
I do not believe . . . that the University of Michigan Law School’s means are
narrowly tailored to the interest it asserts. The Law School claims it must take
the steps it does to achieve a “‘critical mass’” of underrepresented minority
students. But its actual program bears no relation to this asserted goal. . . .
From  1995  through  2000,  the  Law  School  admitted  between  1,130
and 1,310 students. Of those, between 13 and
